text: when I was 16 years old
it was like walking into heaven it was a
really a resort area summer resort area
I mean there were hundreds and hundreds
of bungalows up the beach around a
boardwalk you 3 o'clock in the morning
you'd walk the boardwalk would be
crowded there is in everybody beat would
be such a happy occasion
due to the white flight of the 70s and
80s Far Rockaway was left with many
abandoned stores homes and churches but
the hundred and fifty two year old
parish of st. Mary's star of the sea
found renewed faith and immigration
in the early YZ there was a large influx
of hispanics and for st. mary's it's
encouraged reasons very a blessing
because traditionally hispanics are
mostly catholic some of the new english
but the majority of them did not so this
was really a welcoming space for the
hispanic community and as a result this
church st. mary's is very dependent on
the Spanish callate in order to survive
from 1950 to 2009 the number of Hispanic
parishioners at st. Mary has grown from
a small handful to nearly half of the
entire congregation over the same period
the number of Anglo parishioners has
dropped for more than 90 percent to less
than 15% there have been a lot of
changes because a lot of people have
emigrated from other countries so much
that the mass now is quite diverse I was
baptized here and all my life all my
life growing up I went to st. Mary star
to see school so my religious education
education formerly was always here and
always bought in the church when I grew
up the church is really more reserved
now with some more festive like I was
singing a lot more welcoming where the
english-speaking community people would
come see a priest than an arranged
baptism or a wedding or maybe for
confession maybe some counseling in the
spanish-speaking community the role of
the priest is different in the sense
that the priest is the one you go to
about problems all kinds of problems
whether it's marital problems individual
problems spiritual problems personal
problems financial problems the priest
is that is the person that you go to and
if you go to the masses demand the
Spanish Mass and 11:00 11:30 is really
crowded with the people don't fit there
some of them have to stand outside and
of course the Spanish community has 20
countries so when the bishop it called
the nets to see me I assumed it was for
something else and I had breakfast with
him and I remember him telling me that I
was the pastor Saint Mary started seeing
Far Rockaway and I thought he made a
mistake because I didn't speak Spanish
normally
I still don't speak Spanish fluently but
I certainly much better than it used to
be sometimes we get services in three
languages that is a big change at one
time when I pull up everything in the
master itself
but everything else was in English this
is an immigrant diocese you know mass is
celebrated in Brooklyn and Queens on
Sunday in 18 languages but don't forget
that we never stop coming never stop
immigrating every day I see new people
new faces and they're immigrants and the
majority are very young
